author: detroitnews.com
title: Michigan announces ‘College GameDay’ details
text:
Lee Corso and ESPN’s “College GameDay” was at Cowboys Stadium in 2012 for the Michigan-Alabama game. (Photo: John T. Greilick, Detroit News) 
ESPN’s College GameDay will set up at the north end of the Diag at Michigan, and run from 9 a.m. until noon Saturday, according to a release Wednesday from the university.
No. 12 Michigan (5-1, 2-0 Big Ten) plays host to No. 7 Michigan State (6-0, 2-0) at 3:30 p.m. Saturday at Michigan Stadium. The game will be broadcast on ESPN.
The main stage for GameDay will be near North University Street between the Kraus and chemistry buildings. From the release:
“Fans are encouraged to make creative signs for a competition sponsored by Pizza Hut and there will be a sign painting station provided by Home Depot. There will also be fan activities, a Coke Zero tent and a Cheez-It Real Fan of the Week presentation. The College GameDay Home Depot Bus will also be on site.”
It’s the second time ESPN will have a set on the Ann Arbor campus this season, following a SportsCenter broadcast in Jim Harbaugh’s home debut as coach Sept. 12 against Oregon State. GameDay last appeared at Michigan in 2013, when Notre Dame came to town. Michigan won, 41-30.
